channel.title: My tv
channel.description:
So i bought one today
32 inch LED Backlit Full HD 1080p Sandstrom :D
http://www.pcworld.co.uk/gbuk/sandstrom-ledtv-03864750-pdt.html
EDIT: Sorry wrong section, Mod move please?

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:25, topic:366110”][quote author=Man UTD Freak link=topic=462301.msg3387234#msg3387234 date=1288565249]

Getting Sky+HD in too gonna be an awesome setup

Have fun watching Football all day. Fucking jealous.
[/quote]

I couldn’t think of which phrase to post, so heres both:

Why the fuck would you want to watch football all day? Wait thats wrong, who would want to watch football?

Who in their right mind would want to watch football all day?[/quote]

Not me.

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:25, topic:366110”][quote author=Man UTD Freak link=topic=462301.msg3387234#msg3387234 date=1288565249]

Getting Sky+HD in too gonna be an awesome setup

Have fun watching Football all day. Fucking jealous.
[/quote]

I couldn’t think of which phrase to post, so heres both:

Why the fuck would you want to watch football all day? Wait thats wrong, who would want to watch football?

Who in their right mind would want to watch football all day?[/quote]

Yeah well no shit, figurative language was intended but I will answer your questions in the manner that you have asked them regardless.

To your 1st question: Because I can.

To your 2nd question: Tell that to the majority of the world.

To your 3rd question: Myself.

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:366110”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=462301.msg3383890#msg3383890 date=1288286900]
The expensive HDMI cables are no different than the cheap ones. It is a digital signal, it is either on or off, there will be no noticeable visual difference between lesser quality cables or higher quality ones.
[/quote]

BUT WHAT ABOUT IF ITS GOLD PLATED[/quote]

Well, the gold plated connector converts it into a super digital signal and the visual quality upgrades. On/Off/ON!!!

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:366110”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=462301.msg3383890#msg3383890 date=1288286900]
The expensive HDMI cables are no different than the cheap ones. It is a digital signal, it is either on or off, there will be no noticeable visual difference between lesser quality cables or higher quality ones.
[/quote]

BUT WHAT ABOUT IF ITS GOLD PLATED[/quote]

my keyboard has a gold plated usb connector, as does my mouse. i didnt notice a difference until i overclocked them both, people still think i cheat in game
im waiting on my gold plated nic

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

We got our 37" LCD for quite a heavy price in comparison to nowadays as we did get it a few years back.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:366110”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=462301.msg3382490#msg3382490 date=1288150247]

I still like my 65" Mitsubishi DLP (1080P) TV that I bought a few years ago, haven’t had a problem yet and the picture still looks great.

only thing I dont like about DLP is viewing angles and poor back lighting.
[/quote]

I was concerned about that before I bought it, but the view doesn’t change from any angle, unlike some projection TVs I’ve seen, and the backlighting is just fine except in cases of ridiculously dark shows. Overall, I’m happy with it, and it was the best deal when I bought it, LCDs and Plasmas of the same size back then ran somewhere around $4000 or up, and this was like $1400.[/quote]

Wow! $4000 or up even though it is a 65"??? How far back was this?

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @Cbot Cbot
item.description:
@Cbot wrote:

Ollie:

looks nice, but I prefer my 42" I got from asda for an extra £100. Although mins is not an LED backlit, does it improve the picture significantly?

Same except mine was WestingHouse.
Uses 20% less energy than a 100 watt light bulb, slim and cheap. Love it. (Except for the ONE dead pixel that I only notice when I focus in on it)

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Ollie:

looks nice, but I prefer my 42" I got from asda for an extra £100. Although mins is not an LED backlit, does it improve the picture significantly?

No, LED backlit televisions simply use less electricity than standard fluorescent lamp sets.

Although you got yourself quite a reasonably big tv for very little money, I wouldn’t have much confidence in that brand since I have never heard of it before. I would not be surprised if it breaks after a year or two but I’m sure that wont be much bother considering the price and the $$$ you’ll be making then.

Read full topic

item.title: My tv
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:7, topic:366110”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=462301.msg3381920#msg3381920 date=1288116042]
I still like my 65" Mitsubishi DLP (1080P) TV that I bought a few years ago, haven’t had a problem yet and the picture still looks great.
[/quote]
only thing I dont like about DLP is viewing angles and poor back lighting.[/quote]

I was concerned about that before I bought it, but the view doesn’t change from any angle, unlike some projection TVs I’ve seen, and the backlighting is just fine except in cases of ridiculously dark shows. Overall, I’m happy with it, and it was the best deal when I bought it, LCDs and Plasmas of the same size back then ran somewhere around $4000 or up, and this was like $1400.

Read full topic
